title: God
data:
| ***[Religion](/wiki/Religion "Religion") in NetHack***                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| - [priests](/wiki/Aligned_priest "Aligned priest")
- [alignment](/wiki/Alignment "Alignment")
- [alignment record](/wiki/Alignment_record "Alignment record")
- [altars](/wiki/Altar "Altar")
- [atheism](/wiki/Atheist "Atheist")
- [anger](/wiki/Anger "Anger")

- *This article is about NetHack's deities. For the item known as “GoD”, see [gauntlets of dexterity](/wiki/Gauntlets_of_dexterity "Gauntlets of dexterity").*

In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, the [role](/wiki/Role "Role") of your [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") determines the **pantheon of gods** that appear during the game. Your task is to retrieve the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor") for the god of your alignment: to [ascend](/wiki/Ascend "Ascend") and win the game, you must [sacrifice](/wiki/Sacrifice "Sacrifice") the amulet at your god's [high altar](/wiki/High_altar "High altar") - you can sometimes #[pray](/wiki/Pray "Pray") to your god in times of need, though be careful not to [anger](/wiki/Anger "Anger") them. The pantheon for a priest(ess) is randomly selected from another single role; if a priest's lawful god is Blind Io, the neutral god is always going to be The Lady.

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

*"Expand on history using on-wiki [source code](/wiki/Source_code "Source code") from versions up to [NetHack 2.3e](/wiki/NetHack_2.3e "NetHack 2.3e")."*

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Description](#Description)
  - [1.1 Other gods](#Other_gods)

- [2 History](#History)

- [3 Origin](#Origin)
  - [3.1 Other deities](#Other_deities)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [4.2 Convict patch](#Convict_patch)
  - [4.3 Pirate patch](#Pirate_patch)
  - [4.4 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)

- [5 Encyclopaedia entry](#Encyclopaedia_entry)

## Description

Each role's pantheon contains one [lawful](/wiki/Lawful "Lawful"), one [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral"), and one [chaotic](/wiki/Chaotic "Chaotic") god; there is no functional difference in gameplay between the gods of different roles. The [unaligned](/wiki/Unaligned "Unaligned") god is always [Moloch](/wiki/Moloch "Moloch"), who holds dominion over prayers and [altars](/wiki/Altar "Altar") in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom"). [Atheist](/wiki/Atheist "Atheist") [conduct](/wiki/Conduct "Conduct") tries to avoid actions directly involving any of the gods and other aspects of [religion](/wiki/Religion "Religion").

The divine pantheons are listed as follows:

|                                                      | Lawful                                                                                                                                      | Neutral                                              | Chaotic                                                       |
| ---------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [Archaeologist](/wiki/Archaeologist "Archaeologist") | [Quetzalcoatl](/wiki/Quetzalcoatl "Quetzalcoatl")                                                                                           | [Camaxtli](/wiki/Camaxtli "Camaxtli")                | [Huhetotl](/wiki/Huhetotl "Huhetotl")                         |
| [Barbarian](/wiki/Barbarian "Barbarian")             | [Mitra](/wiki/Mitra "Mitra")                                                                                                                | [Crom](/wiki/Crom "Crom")                            | [Set](/wiki/Set "Set")                                        |
| [Caveman](/wiki/Caveman "Caveman")                   | [Anu](/wiki/Anu "Anu")                                                                                                                      | [Ishtar](/wiki/Ishtar "Ishtar")                      | [Anshar](/wiki/Anshar "Anshar")                               |
| [Healer](/wiki/Healer "Healer")                      | [Athena](/wiki/Athena "Athena")                                                                                                             | [Hermes](/wiki/Hermes "Hermes")                      | [Poseidon](/wiki/Poseidon "Poseidon")                         |
| [Knight](/wiki/Knight "Knight")                      | [Lugh](/wiki/Lugh "Lugh")                                                                                                                   | [Brigit](/wiki/Brigit "Brigit")                      | [Manannan Mac Lir](/wiki/Manannan_Mac_Lir "Manannan Mac Lir") |
| [Monk](/wiki/Monk "Monk")                            | [Shan Lai Ching](/wiki/Shan_Lai_Ching "Shan Lai Ching")                                                                                     | [Chih Sung-tzu](/wiki/Chih_Sung-tzu "Chih Sung-tzu") | [Huan Ti](/wiki/Huan_Ti "Huan Ti")                            |
| [Priest](/wiki/Priest "Priest")                      | random                                                                                                                                      | random                                               | random                                                        |
| [Ranger](/wiki/Ranger "Ranger")                      | [Mercury](/wiki/Mercury "Mercury")                                                                                                          | [Venus](/wiki/Venus "Venus")                         | [Mars](/wiki/Mars "Mars")                                     |
| [Rogue](/wiki/Rogue "Rogue")                         | [Issek](/wiki/Issek "Issek")                                                                                                                | [Mog](/wiki/Mog "Mog")                               | [Kos](/wiki/Kos "Kos")                                        |
| [Samurai](/wiki/Samurai "Samurai")                   | [Amaterasu Omikami](/wiki/Amaterasu_Omikami "Amaterasu Omikami")                                                                            | [Raijin](/wiki/Raijin "Raijin")                      | [Susanowo](/wiki/Susanowo "Susanowo")                         |
| [Tourist](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist")                   | [Blind Io](/wiki/Blind_Io "Blind Io")                                                                                                       | [The Lady](/wiki/The_Lady "The Lady")                | [Offler](/wiki/Offler "Offler")                               |
| [Valkyrie](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie")                | [Tyr](/wiki/Tyr "Tyr")                                                                                                                      | [Odin](/wiki/Odin "Odin")                            | [Loki](/wiki/Loki "Loki")                                     |
| [Wizard](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard")                      | [Ptah](/wiki/Ptah "Ptah")                                                                                                                   | [Thoth](/wiki/Thoth "Thoth")                         | [Anhur](/wiki/Anhur "Anhur")                                  |
| Unaligned                                            | [Marduk](/wiki/Marduk "Marduk") · [Moloch](/wiki/Moloch "Moloch") · [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth") · [Arioch](/wiki/Arioch "Arioch") |                                                      |                                                               |

### Other gods

Of the other "unaligned" gods, [Marduk](/wiki/Marduk "Marduk") is described in the [introductory text](/wiki/Introduction "Introduction") as the Creator, from whom Moloch stole the Amulet of Yendor. [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth") is an elf-goddess whose name can be [engraved](/wiki/Engraved "Engraved") to frighten most monsters, but not all of them.

## History

Pantheons are introduced in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0") - in previous versions of *NetHack*, there are no sacrifice mechanics or altars, and prayers are made to "**the gods**" in general. The exact mechanics vary between these versions, but do include the standard starting cooldown of 300 turns and longer wait times between prayer for a [demigod](/wiki/Demigod "Demigod") character.

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Deity](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deity "wikipedia:Deity")***

A god or deity is a supernatural being considered to be divine or sacred. One commonly accepted definition of a god is "a being with powers greater than those of ordinary humans, but who interacts with humans, positively or negatively, in ways that carry humans to new levels of consciousness, beyond the grounded preoccupations of ordinary life". A pantheon is the particular set of all gods of any individual polytheistic religion, mythology, or tradition.

The *NetHack* pantheons and related [quests](/wiki/Quest "Quest") for each role are derived from a mix of real-world and fictional sources:

- Archeologist: [Aztec mythology](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aztec_mythology "wikipedia:Aztec mythology")
- Barbarian: [Robert E. Howard's](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_E._Howard "wikipedia:Robert E. Howard") *[Conan](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conan_the_Barbarian "wikipedia:Conan the Barbarian")* mythos
- Caveman: [Mesopotamian mythology](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mesopotamian_mythology "wikipedia:Mesopotamian mythology")
- Healer: [Greek mythology](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greek_mythology "wikipedia:Greek mythology")
- Knight: [Celtic mythology](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Celtic_mythology "wikipedia:Celtic mythology")
- Monk: [Chinese mythology](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_mythology "wikipedia:Chinese mythology")
- Ranger: [Roman mythology](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roman_mythology "wikipedia:Roman mythology")
- Rogue: [Fritz Leiber's](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fritz_Leiber "wikipedia:Fritz Leiber") *[Fafhrd and the Gray Mouser](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fafhrd_and_the_Gray_Mouser "wikipedia:Fafhrd and the Gray Mouser")* mythos
- Samurai: [Japanese mythology](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_mythology "wikipedia:Japanese mythology")
- Tourist: [Terry Pratchett](/wiki/Terry_Pratchett "Terry Pratchett")'s *[Discworld](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Discworld "wikipedia:Discworld")* mythos
- Valkyrie: [Norse mythology](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Norse_mythology "wikipedia:Norse mythology")
- Wizard: [Egyptian mythology](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Egyptian_mythology "wikipedia:Egyptian mythology")

### Other deities

- Marduk: [Babylonian mythology](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Babylonian_mythology "wikipedia:Babylonian mythology")
- Moloch: Ammonite mythology (in the Bible in the form "Molech," q.v. 1 Kings 11:7; Moloch is the Greek form of the Hebrew מֹּֽלֶךְ found in LXX in 2 Kings 23:10)
- Elbereth: [J.R.R. Tolkien](/wiki/J.R.R._Tolkien "J.R.R. Tolkien")'s [Middle-earth](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Middle-earth "wikipedia:Middle-earth") mythos
- Arioch: [Michael Moorcock](/wiki/Michael_Moorcock "Michael Moorcock")'s *[Elric of Melniboné](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elric_of_Melnibon%C3%A9 "wikipedia:Elric of Melniboné")* mythos

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") introduces the following pantheons to correspond with the newly added roles:

|                                                      | Lawful                                         | Neutral                                           | Chaotic                                             | Origin                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [Undead Slayer](/wiki/Undead_Slayer "Undead Slayer") | [Seeker](/wiki/Seeker "Seeker")                | [Osiris](/wiki/Osiris "Osiris")                   | [Seth](/wiki/Seth_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Seth (SLASH'EM)") | Egyptian mythology (Seeker is likely a misspelling of [Seker](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seker "wikipedia:Seker"))                                           |
| [Flame Mage](/wiki/Flame_Mage "Flame Mage")          | [Earth](/wiki/Earth "Earth")                   | [Fire](/wiki/Fire "Fire")                         | [Ash](/wiki/Ash "Ash")                              | Aspects of fire                                                                                                                                                |
| [Ice Mage](/wiki/Ice_Mage "Ice Mage")                | [Air](/wiki/Air "Air")                         | [Frost](/wiki/Frost "Frost")                      | [Smoke](/wiki/Smoke "Smoke")                        | Aspects of ice                                                                                                                                                 |
| [Yeoman](/wiki/Yeoman "Yeoman")                      | [His Majesty](/wiki/His_Majesty "His Majesty") | [His Holiness](/wiki/His_Holiness "His Holiness") | [The Commons](/wiki/The_Commons "The Commons")      | [The English Civil War](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_English_Civil_War "wikipedia:The English Civil War")                                                  |
| [Necromancer](/wiki/Necromancer "Necromancer")       | [Nharlotep](/wiki/Nharlotep "Nharlotep")       | [Zuggothobal](/wiki/Zuggothobal "Zuggothobal")    | [Gothuulbe](/wiki/Gothuulbe "Gothuulbe")            | [Invented](https://rec.games.roguelike.nethack.narkive.com/MrSKt1jc/s-gothuulbe), possibly inspired by [Cthulhu Mythos](/wiki/Cthulhu_Mythos "Cthulhu Mythos") |

### Convict patch

The [Convict](/wiki/Convict "Convict") patch adds the Convict as a new role with its own pantheon, based on the Forgotten Realms mythology.

|                                    | Lawful                             | Neutral                            | Chaotic                         |
| ---------------------------------- | ---------------------------------- | ---------------------------------- | ------------------------------- |
| [Convict](/wiki/Convict "Convict") | [Ilmater](/wiki/Ilmater "Ilmater") | [Grumbar](/wiki/Grumbar "Grumbar") | [Tymora](/wiki/Tymora "Tymora") |

### Pirate patch

The [Pirate](/wiki/Pirate "Pirate") patch adds the Pirate as a new role with its own nautically-inspired pantheon

|                                 | Lawful     | Neutral           | Chaotic   |
| ------------------------------- | ---------- | ----------------- | --------- |
| [Pirate](/wiki/Pirate "Pirate") | Davy Jones | the deep blue sea | the storm |

### [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack")

SpliceHack incorporates the Convict patch and Pirate patch. It has some original roles with their own pantheons.

| Role                                              | Lawful | Neutral | Chaotic    | Source                                                                                                                         |
| ------------------------------------------------- | ------ | ------- | ---------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| [Cartomancer](/wiki/Cartomancer "Cartomancer")    | Johnny | Spike   | Timmy      | [Magic the Gathering archetypes](https://magic.wizards.com/en/articles/archive/making-magic/timmy-johnny-and-spike-2013-12-03) |
| [Dragon rider](/wiki/Dragon_rider "Dragon rider") | Enki   | Enlil   | Ereshkigal | [Sumerian](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sumerian_religion "wikipedia:Sumerian religion")                                       |

## Encyclopaedia entry

Goddesses and Gods operate in ones, threesomes, or whole  
pantheons of nine or more (see Religion). Most of them claim  
to have made the world, and this is indeed a likely claim in  
the case of threesomes or pantheons: Fantasyland does have  
the air of having been made by a committee. But all Goddesses  
and Gods, whether they say they made the world or not, have  
very detailed short-term plans for it which they are determined  
to carry out. Consequently they tend to push people into the  
required actions by the use of coincidence or Prophecy, or just  
by narrowing down your available choices of what to do next:  
if a deity is pushing you, things will go miserably badly until  
there is only one choice left to you.

\[ The Tough Guide to Fantasyland, by Diana Wynne Jones ]

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
God

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Religion in NetHack
  • priests
  • alignment
  • alignment record
  • altars
  • atheism
  • anger
  • gods
  • sacrifice
  • prayer
  • turn undead
This article is about NetHack's deities. For the item known as “GoD”, see gauntlets of dexterity.

In NetHack, the role of your hero determines the pantheon of gods that appear during the game. Your task is to retrieve the Amulet of Yendor for the god of your alignment: to ascend and win the game, you must sacrifice the amulet at your god's high altar - you can sometimes #pray to your god in times of need, though be careful not to anger them. The pantheon for a priest(ess) is randomly selected from another single role; if a priest's lawful god is Blind Io, the neutral god is always going to be The Lady.

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

"Expand on history using on-wiki source code from versions up to NetHack 2.3e."

Contents

  • 1 Description
    • 1.1 Other gods
  • 2 History
  • 3 Origin
    • 3.1 Other deities
  • 4 Variants
    • 4.1 SLASH'EM
    • 4.2 Convict patch
    • 4.3 Pirate patch
    • 4.4 SpliceHack
  • 5 Encyclopaedia entry

Description

Each role's pantheon contains one lawful, one neutral, and one chaotic god; there is no functional difference in gameplay between the gods of different roles. The unaligned god is always Moloch, who holds dominion over prayers and altars in Gehennom. Atheist conduct tries to avoid actions directly involving any of the gods and other aspects of religion.

The divine pantheons are listed as follows:

Lawful Neutral Chaotic
Archaeologist Quetzalcoatl Camaxtli Huhetotl
Barbarian Mitra Crom Set
Caveman Anu Ishtar Anshar
Healer Athena Hermes Poseidon
Knight Lugh Brigit Manannan Mac Lir
Monk Shan Lai Ching Chih Sung-tzu Huan Ti
Priest random random random
Ranger Mercury Venus Mars
Rogue Issek Mog Kos
Samurai Amaterasu Omikami Raijin Susanowo
Tourist Blind Io The Lady Offler
Valkyrie Tyr Odin Loki
Wizard Ptah Thoth Anhur
Unaligned Marduk · Moloch · Elbereth · Arioch

Other gods

Of the other "unaligned" gods, Marduk is described in the introductory text as the Creator, from whom Moloch stole the Amulet of Yendor. Elbereth is an elf-goddess whose name can be engraved to frighten most monsters, but not all of them.

History

Pantheons are introduced in NetHack 3.0.0 - in previous versions of NetHack, there are no sacrifice mechanics or altars, and prayers are made to "the gods" in general. The exact mechanics vary between these versions, but do include the standard starting cooldown of 300 turns and longer wait times between prayer for a demigod character.

Origin

Wikipedia has an article about:
Deity

A god or deity is a supernatural being considered to be divine or sacred. One commonly accepted definition of a god is "a being with powers greater than those of ordinary humans, but who interacts with humans, positively or negatively, in ways that carry humans to new levels of consciousness, beyond the grounded preoccupations of ordinary life". A pantheon is the particular set of all gods of any individual polytheistic religion, mythology, or tradition.

The NetHack pantheons and related quests for each role are derived from a mix of real-world and fictional sources:

  • Archeologist: Aztec mythology
  • Barbarian: Robert E. Howard's Conan mythos
  • Caveman: Mesopotamian mythology
  • Healer: Greek mythology
  • Knight: Celtic mythology
  • Monk: Chinese mythology
  • Ranger: Roman mythology
  • Rogue: Fritz Leiber's Fafhrd and the Gray Mouser mythos
  • Samurai: Japanese mythology
  • Tourist: Terry Pratchett's Discworld mythos
  • Valkyrie: Norse mythology
  • Wizard: Egyptian mythology

Other deities

  • Marduk: Babylonian mythology
  • Moloch: Ammonite mythology (in the Bible in the form "Molech," q.v. 1 Kings 11:7; Moloch is the Greek form of the Hebrew מֹּֽלֶךְ found in LXX in 2 Kings 23:10)
  • Elbereth: J.R.R. Tolkien's Middle-earth mythos
  • Arioch: Michael Moorcock's Elric of Melniboné mythos

Variants

SLASH'EM

SLASH'EM introduces the following pantheons to correspond with the newly added roles:

Lawful Neutral Chaotic Origin
Undead Slayer Seeker Osiris Seth Egyptian mythology (Seeker is likely a misspelling of Seker)
Flame Mage Earth Fire Ash Aspects of fire
Ice Mage Air Frost Smoke Aspects of ice
Yeoman His Majesty His Holiness The Commons The English Civil War
Necromancer Nharlotep Zuggothobal Gothuulbe Invented, possibly inspired by Cthulhu Mythos

Convict patch

The Convict patch adds the Convict as a new role with its own pantheon, based on the Forgotten Realms mythology.

Lawful Neutral Chaotic
Convict Ilmater Grumbar Tymora

Pirate patch

The Pirate patch adds the Pirate as a new role with its own nautically-inspired pantheon

Lawful Neutral Chaotic
Pirate Davy Jones the deep blue sea the storm

SpliceHack

SpliceHack incorporates the Convict patch and Pirate patch. It has some original roles with their own pantheons.

Role Lawful Neutral Chaotic Source
Cartomancer Johnny Spike Timmy Magic the Gathering archetypes
Dragon rider Enki Enlil Ereshkigal Sumerian

Encyclopaedia entry

Goddesses and Gods operate in ones, threesomes, or whole
pantheons of nine or more (see Religion). Most of them claim
to have made the world, and this is indeed a likely claim in
the case of threesomes or pantheons: Fantasyland does have
the air of having been made by a committee. But all Goddesses
and Gods, whether they say they made the world or not, have
very detailed short-term plans for it which they are determined
to carry out. Consequently they tend to push people into the
required actions by the use of coincidence or Prophecy, or just
by narrowing down your available choices of what to do next:
if a deity is pushing you, things will go miserably badly until
there is only one choice left to you.

[ The Tough Guide to Fantasyland, by Diana Wynne Jones ]

In ''[[NetHack]]'', the [[role]] of your [[hero]] determines the '''pantheon of gods''' that appear during the game. Your task is to retrieve the [[Amulet of Yendor]] for the god of your alignment: to [[ascend]] and win the game, you must [[sacrifice]] the amulet at your god's [[high altar]] - you can sometimes #[[pray]] to your god in times of need, though be careful not to [[anger]] them. The pantheon for a priest(ess) is randomly selected from another single role; if a priest's lawful god is Blind Io, the neutral god is always going to be The Lady.

Each role's pantheon contains one [[lawful]], one [[neutral]], and one [[chaotic]] god; there is no functional difference in gameplay between the gods of different roles. Pantheons are introduced in [[NetHack 3.0.0]] - in previous versions of ''NetHack'', there are no sacrifice mechanics or altars, and prayers are made to "'''the gods'''" in general. The exact mechanics vary between these versions, but do include the standard starting cooldown of 300 turns and longer wait times between prayer for a [[demigod]] character.

One commonly accepted definition of a god is "a being with powers greater than those of ordinary humans, but who interacts with humans, positively or negatively, in ways that carry humans to new levels of consciousness, beyond the grounded preoccupations of ordinary life". A pantheon is the particular set of all gods of any individual polytheistic religion, mythology, or tradition.

The [[Convict]] patch adds the Convict as a new role with its own pantheon, based on the Forgotten Realms mythology.

==Encyclopaedia entry==
{{encyclopedia|
Goddesses and Gods operate in ones, threesomes, or whole
pantheons of nine or more (see Religion).  Most of them claim
to have made the world, and this is indeed a likely claim in
the case of threesomes or pantheons:  Fantasyland does have
the air of having been made by a committee.  But all Goddesses
and Gods, whether they say they made the world or not, have
very detailed short-term plans for it which they are determined
to carry out.  Consequently they tend to push people into the
required actions by the use of coincidence or Prophecy, or just
by narrowing down your available choices of what to do next:
if a deity is pushing you, things will go miserably badly until
there is only one choice left to you.
|[ The Tough Guide to Fantasyland, by Diana Wynne Jones ]
}}
{{nethack-367}}
